xwikidoc.author: XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 04 July 2013
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 11:06 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 12:49 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 12:49 <sdumitriu1> Hey bvancea 12:49 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu 12:49 <bvancea> did you have trouble connecting to freenode today? 12:49 <sdumitriu1> No 12:49 <bvancea> blah 12:49 <sdumitriu1> Did you? 12:49 <bvancea> yes, it said it cannot establish connection 12:50 <bvancea> I can only connect through webchat.freenode 12:50 <bvancea> as it has a separate proxy server 12:50 <bvancea> dorm internet stops standalone clients from connecting 12:52 <bvancea> anyway, I've been struggling with a weird error implementing the translator 12:52 <bvancea> did you work with sablecc? 12:57 <sdumitriu1> No 12:57 <bvancea> hmm 12:59 <bvancea> I have this annoying exception 12:59 <bvancea> can't get the parser to contruct the grammar tree 12:59 <bvancea> I've gotten to the point where I just copied the grammar file from xwiki 13:00 <bvancea> and the parser still gives an exception 13:01 <sdumitriu1> What's the stacktrace? 13:02 <bvancea> http://pastebin.com/fUVxeaJ1 13:03 <sdumitriu1> What's the query? 13:03 <bvancea> "select a from Variant" 13:04 <sdumitriu1> OK, the error says that you have to specify an alias 13:04 <bvancea> I have some logic in place to get the term values following the where "" 13:04 <sdumitriu1> So the full query should be "select v.a from Variant v" 13:04 <sdumitriu1> Try this one, see if it works 13:04 <sdumitriu1> brb 13:04 <bvancea> okay 13:04 <bvancea> thans 13:04 <bvancea> thanks* 13:06 <bvancea> yay it works 13:06 <bvancea> man, I'm so embarassed 13:06 <bvancea> :( 13:40 <sdumitriu1> It's OK 13:40 <sdumitriu1> It should work with the simplified syntax 13:41 <sdumitriu1> Especially since we don't have joins 13:41 <bvancea> yup 13:41 <sdumitriu1> Hm, although I'm not sure that's allowed by the JPQL standard 13:41 <bvancea> what do you mean? 13:42 <bvancea> the fact that we would ignore joins? 13:42 <sdumitriu1> No, that we don't specify an alias 13:42 <sdumitriu1> It isn't allowed 13:42 <sdumitriu1> range_variable_declaration ::= abstract_schema_name [AS] identification_variable 13:43 <sdumitriu1> So it's mandatory to specify the identification_variable 13:43 <sdumitriu1> If we want to be closer to JPQL 13:44 <bvancea> hmmm 13:44 <bvancea> true 13:46 <sdumitriu1> "select v from Variant v" should work, though 13:48 <sdumitriu1> We should make sure that we support both "select v" and "select v.prop" 13:49 <bvancea> hmm 13:49 <bvancea> what should "select v.prop" do ? 13:50 <bvancea> I mean, the documents return all fields 13:50 <sdumitriu1> Well, in Solr we always get the whole document 13:50 <sdumitriu1> So we just iterate through all the results and manually build a list of values 13:51 <bvancea> oh, I understand 13:51 <bvancea> makes sense 13:51 <bvancea> so we should build some sort of resultset 13:51 <sdumitriu1> Yes 13:51 <bvancea> what contains the variables 13:52 <sdumitriu1> There are special cases to consider 13:52 <bvancea> I need to add that to the abstraction layer 13:52 <sdumitriu1> select v will build domain objects 13:52 <sdumitriu1> select v.prop, v.prop2 will build arrays of values 13:53 <bvancea> hmm 13:53 <bvancea> yep 13:53 <bvancea> sounds nice 13:53 <sdumitriu1> select count(v) will ignore the start/rows and always select zero results, since the count is always there 13:58 <bvancea> yup 14:32 <bvancea> yay 14:32 <bvancea> just got an email 14:32 <bvancea> my second paper got accepted aswell 14:32 <bvancea> :D 14:36 <sdumitriu1> Where? 14:36 <bvancea> http://www.iccp.ro/iccp2013/ 14:37 <sdumitriu1> Nice 14:37 <sdumitriu1> Congrats 14:37 <bvancea> its indexed in IEEE 14:37 <bvancea> not the best quality conference from what I understand 14:37 <bvancea> but still 14:37 <bvancea> :) 14:37 <bvancea> thanks 14:39 <bvancea> I mean, you can tell it's not the best of conferences when they tell you they're announcing on the 1st and send the emails on the 4th 14:40 <sdumitriu1> They had some international papers last year 14:41 <sdumitriu1> (and a whole bunch co-authored by Sergiu Nedevschi) 14:41 <bvancea> hmm 14:42 <bvancea> my girlfriend works in his research department 14:42 <bvancea> her paper got accepted aswell 14:42 <sdumitriu1> Oh, so they just announced now and the CR paper is due tomorrow? 14:43 <bvancea> no no 14:43 <bvancea> they didn't update it on the website 14:43 <bvancea> CR due on the 14th 14:46 <bvancea> its funny, because there guy updating the website is a RA in Nedevschi's dept 14:46 <bvancea> I guess he keeps forgetting to update 22:20 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant
